worked_examples.title: APV: Leveraged Buyout Analysis
worked_examples.problem_statement: A private equity fund plans an LBO of Firm R: Transaction Structure: ●​ ●​ ●​ ●​ Unlevered firm value: $600m Purchase price: $600m (assume equals unlevered value for simplicity) Debt at close: $400m at 10% interest Equity contribution: $200m Debt Amortization: ●​ Debt repaid linearly over 8 years ($50m principal per year) ●​ Tax rate: 25% ●​ Discount tax shields at 10%

sub_questions.question_text: Base unlevered NPV (10 pts)
PV of tax shields (20 pts)
Why APV is useful here (15 pts)

workflow.extract: Pull key parameters from problem statement

solution.content:
Question 1 – APV: Leveraged Buyout Analysis (60 points)
A private equity fund plans an LBO of Firm R:
Transaction Structure:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Unlevered firm value: $600m
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Purchase price: $600m (assume equals unlevered value for simplicity)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Debt at close: $400m at 10% interest
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Equity contribution: $200m
Debt Amortization:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Debt repaid linearly over 8 years ($50m principal per year)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Tax rate: 25%
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Discount tax shields at 10%
________________


A. Base unlevered NPV (10 pts)
Since the purchase price equals unlevered value, the base NPV = 0.
State this briefly (1-2 sentences). The value creation comes from financing (APV).
________________


B. Annual interest schedule (15 pts)
Compute the interest expense for each year (approximate):
Year 1: 10% × $400m Year 2: 10% × $350m (after $50m repayment) Year 3: 10% × $300m ... Year 8: 10% × $50m
Present as a schedule showing declining interest as principal is repaid.
________________


C. PV of tax shields (20 pts)
For each year, compute:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Tax shield = 0.25 × Interest (from part B)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Discount at 10%
Sum the PV of all 8 years of tax shields.
Show your calculation (you may use formula for declining annuity or sum year-by-year).
________________


D. Why APV is useful here (15 pts)
In 4-5 sentences, explain how APV (Adjusted Present Value) is particularly useful for analyzing LBOs where leverage changes over time.
Discuss:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * APV separates unlevered value from financing effects
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * WACC approach requires recalculating WACC each year as leverage changes
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * APV is cleaner when debt is predetermined (known amortization schedule)
________________

worked_examples.problem_statement: The PE fund expects to exit in year 5. At exit: Equity Value Scenarios: State Probability Equity Value at Exit (Year 5) Low 30% $200m Base 50% $400m High 20% $700m Debt outstanding at exit: $200m (after 5 years of amortization) Initial equity investment: $200m (at t=0)

sub_questions.question_text: Equity IRR by state (25 pts)
Expected IRR (15 pts)
IRR without risk adjustment is misleading (20 pts)

workflow.extract: Pull key parameters from problem statement

solution.content:
Question 3 – Multi-State Exit Values in LBO (80 points)
The PE fund expects to exit in year 5. At exit:
Equity Value Scenarios:
State
	Probability
	Equity Value at Exit (Year 5)
	Low
	30%
	$200m
	Base
	50%
	$400m
	High
	20%
	$700m
	Debt outstanding at exit: $200m (after 5 years of amortization)
Initial equity investment: $200m (at t=0)
________________


A. Equity IRR by state (25 pts)
For each state, compute the gross equity IRR:
$$\text{IRR: } 200 \times (1 + \text{IRR})^5 = \text{Exit Equity Value}$$
Solve for IRR in each state:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Low: $200m exit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Base: $400m exit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * High: $700m exit
Show your calculations.
________________


B. Expected IRR (15 pts)
Compute the probability-weighted expected IRR:
Expected IRR = 0.30(IRR_Low) + 0.50(IRR_Base) + 0.20(IRR_High)
Show your result.
________________


C. IRR without risk adjustment is misleading (20 pts)
In 5-6 sentences, explain why IRR can be misleading if used without considering risk.
Discuss:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * IRR assumes cash flows are reinvested at the IRR (unrealistic)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * High IRR might come from high risk, not high skill
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Need to compare IRR to risk-adjusted required return (hurdle rate)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Whether expected IRR > hurdle is a valid investment criterion
________________


D. Leverage amplifies IRR dispersion (20 pts)
In 4-5 sentences, explain how leverage amplifies the dispersion of equity IRRs (makes the range wider).
Discuss:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Small changes in firm value → large changes in equity value
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Option-like payoff for equity
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Compare IRR range here to what it would be if the deal were all-equity
________________

solution.content:
Question 2 – Short Conceptual Questions (40 points)
Answer each part briefly but completely.
________________


A. Trade-off vs pecking order theory (15 pts)
In 4-6 sentences, contrast the trade-off theory and pecking order theory of capital structure.
Key differences:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * What drives financing decisions in each theory?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Does each predict a target leverage ratio?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * How does each explain debt vs equity issuance patterns?
________________


B. Volatile earnings favor pecking order (15 pts)
In 3-4 sentences, explain why firms with very volatile earnings might strongly favor the pecking order.
Discuss:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Need to maintain financial slack (avoid external financing in bad states)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Underinvestment costs if forced to issue mispriced equity
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Preference for low leverage to preserve debt capacity
________________


C. Empirical patterns (10 pts)
In 2-3 sentences, cite one empirical pattern that supports each theory.
Examples:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Trade-off: profitable firms have more debt (tax shields)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Pecking order: firms issue equity after stock price run-ups, retain earnings first
________________

worked_examples.title: CAPM: Equity vs Debt Betas
worked_examples.problem_statement: Firm T has the following capital structure: Current Structure: ●​ ●​ ●​ ●​ Total assets (V): $1,000m Debt (D): $400m, β_D = 0.1 Equity (E): $600m Asset β: β_A = 0.8

sub_questions.question_text: Compute current equity beta (15 pts)
Equity beta with higher leverage (15 pts)
Why leverage increases equity beta (15 pts)
Implications for r_E and WACC (15 pts)

workflow.extract: Pull key parameters from problem statement

solution.content:
Question 1 – CAPM: Equity vs Debt Betas (60 points)
Firm T has the following capital structure:
Current Structure:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Total assets (V): $1,000m
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Debt (D): $400m, β_D = 0.1
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Equity (E): $600m
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Asset β: β_A = 0.8
________________


A. Compute current equity beta (15 pts)
Use the unlevering/relevering formula: $$\beta_A = \frac{D}{V}\beta_D + \frac{E}{V}\beta_E$$
Solve for β_E given β_A = 0.8, D = $400m, E = $600m, β_D = 0.1.
Show your work.
________________


B. Equity beta with higher leverage (15 pts)
Now suppose debt increases to $600m (equity falls to $400m, total V still $1,000m).
Assume β_D remains 0.1 and β_A remains 0.8.
Recompute β_E using the same formula.
Show your calculation.
________________


C. Why leverage increases equity beta (15 pts)
In 4-5 sentences, explain why increasing leverage raises β_E even when asset β is unchanged.
Discuss:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Financial leverage amplifies equity's exposure to asset risk
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * Equity's residual claim becomes more volatile
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      * The levered beta formula shows β_E > β_A when D > 0
________________


D. Implications for r_E and WACC (15 pts)
In 4-5 sentences, discuss the implications for:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. Cost of equity (r_E): As β_E rises, does r_E rise? Use CAPM logic.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. WACC: How does this affect firm value in M&M world vs with taxes/distress costs?
________________
